clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial of Oral Midazolam in Pediatric Endoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of Oral Midazolam in Pediatric Endoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of our study was to compare the safety and efficacy of oral midazolam during pediatric endoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock:
Although gastrointestinal endoscopy is widely accepted as fundamental to the diagnosis and treatment of digestive disorders in children, considerable controversy and practice differences persist with respect to the methods and agents used to achieve optimal endoscopic sedation.
Comparison:oral midazolam vs midazolam IV in sedation and comfort scale of pediatric endoscopy.

primary_outcome.measure: efficacy and safety of endoscopy in children with used midazolam

secondary_outcome.measure: patient complications, ease of performing the procedure, time of preparation, time for recovery

intervention.description: oral midazolam, was prepared into a final solution (2.5 mg/mL) from injectable midazolam hydrochloride and a orange flavored syrup. For preparation, midazolam injection (5 mg/mL) was diluted 1:1 with the flavored syrup.
